result.markdown: --- title: "About Me" subtitle: "Hey, I'm Ramatoulaye Bah. I'm a Computer Science and Lingustics undergraduate student at Macalester College currently working as a Library Access & Research Aide." --- ## From Paris to Minnesota I love Minnesota ::: column-margin ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](images/mn.png){fig-alt='A classroom full of students face forward towards the instructor, who stands at a podium at the front of the room. Students have their laptops open on their desks. Three large TV screens are illuminated at the front of the classroom, displaying workshop materials.'} ::: ::: ::: {.extra-small-text .dark-gray-text .topbr} Teaching MEDS students how to build their own personal websites using Quarto! This was especially fun for me, since Quarto was still such a new tool when I first gave this workshop -- it meant a lot of discovery and learning on-the-fly alongside our students. ::: ::: ## ## I was born and grew up in France in the suburbs of Paris where I was raised in a Guinean household with four siblings. Coming from a disadvantaged neighborhood with non-graduate parents, it became my ambition to combat social inequalities by developing my passion for education and technology and realizing the impact I can have on the world. In 10th grade, I was introduced to [United World Colleges (UWC)](https://www.uwc.org/), and after a long selection process, I left for UWC Maastricht, an international high school in the Netherlands that shapes future dreamers and changemakers ready to have an impact on the world of tomorrow. The full scholarship of â‚¬58,000 offered me the opportunity to access a unique education, the International Baccalaureate, surrounded by people from over a hundred different nationalities. This two-year experience encouraged me to take multiple initiatives: I contributed to campus life with Spirit Team; discussed the impacts of colonialism by leading the Decolonise Club; offered a learning environment to students through the Coding Club; created an entrepreneurial project to deconstruct beauty standards with Project Beauty, and much more. I am constantly learning from others and am fortunate to develop my passions while exploring new ones. I am grateful to have been able to take these initiatives while focusing on my studies and fully enjoying my UWC experience. Thanks to these experiences, I was accepted into a recognized liberal arts college in the US, Macalester College, where I have the opportunity to continue exploring my passions and developing my skills on a daily basis. Pursuing a degree in Computer Science at Macalester College to become a software engineer will give me the opportunity to have a positive impact and to be able, later on, to give the same opportunities to young people from a similar background, following the support I received throughout my life. ## Quick Facts About Me 1. I love football (soccer)! I've been playing for over 9 years now with various teams including men's teams, D3 teams, Dutch teams, adult teams, varsity teams or even futsal teams. ## 2. I started programming in middle school with Scratch to familiarize myself with problem solving and pseudocode and later on in high school, I took advantage of the free online resources available to me to further my learning (Codeacademy, Harvard CS50x, Coursera, freeCodeCamp, YouTube etc). 3. Outside of football, I read a lot of books (love the fictional ones!), lift, cook and bake and play video games. One thing I would love to try though is knitting! 4. I speak four languages; French, Jakhanke (ethnic language), English, Spanish; and I'm currently learning Indonesian and Arabic. 5. I'm 18 years old. Born in October, 2005 in France. I now live in St. Paul Minnesota.
